data.text:
It was a scene straight from Apocalypse Now — three helicopters flying overhead with Wagner’s Ride of the Valkyries blasting out. It was 1986, and in the three choppers were the players of AC Milan. A certain Franco Baresi was one of them. He would admit years later that the players were embarrassed.

They were flying over Milan’s Arena Civica, the city’s neoclassical stadium that had been built in 1807. In Francis Ford Coppola’s Oscar-winning 1979 film, which depicts the war in Vietnam, the helicopters precede an attack on a village and signal mass destruction.
